Package cosc202.andie

Class EditableImage

java.lang.Object
cosc202.andie.EditableImage
public class EditableImage extends Object

An image with a set of operations applied to it.

The EditableImage represents an image with a series of operations applied to it. It is fairly core to the ANDIE program, being the central data structure. The operations are applied to a copy of the original image so that they can be undone. THis is what is meant by "A Non-Destructive Image Editor" - you can always undo back to the original image.

Internally the EditableImage has two BufferedImages - the original image and the result of applying the current set of operations to it. The operations themselves are stored on a Stack, with a second Stack being used to allow undone operations to be redone.

CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

  • Constructor Details

    • EditableImage

      public EditableImage()

      Create a new EditableImage.

      A new EditableImage has no image (it is a null reference), and an empty stack of operations.

  • Method Details

    • getDimensions

      Returns the current image dimensions.

    • hasImage

      public boolean hasImage()

      Check if there is an image loaded.

      Returns:
      True if there is an image, false otherwise.

    • hasLocalImage

      public boolean hasLocalImage()
      Check if there is an image open that does not relate to an already saved file. true if there is an image with no file path. false if there is an image with a pre-existing save file, or there is no image currently open.

    • hasUnsavedChanges

      public boolean hasUnsavedChanges()

      Check if there are currently any unsaved changes to the open file.

      Returns:
      True if there are unsaved changes, false otherwise.

    • getAllowedExtensions

      public static String[] getAllowedExtensions()
      Lists the extensions currently available for writing image files, as a copy of the private data field in order to prevent outside classes mutating it.
      Returns:
      An array containing the extensions that the current image writers can use.

    • getOpsExtension

      public static String getOpsExtension()
      Gets the extension that ANDIE uses for operation files.
      Returns:

    • open

      public void open(String filePath)

      Open an image from a file.

      Opens an image from the specified file. Also tries to open a set of operations from the file with .ops added. So if you open some/path/to/image.png, this method will also try to read the operations from some/path/to/image.png.ops.

      Parameters:
      filePath - The file to open the image from.

    • save

      public boolean save()

      Save an image to file.

      Saves an image to the file it was opened from, or the most recent file saved as. Also saves a set of operations from the file with .ops added. So if you save to some/path/to/image.png, this method will also save the current operations to some/path/to/image.png.ops.

      Returns:
      Whether the operation was successful.

    • saveAs

      public boolean saveAs(String imageFilename)

      Save an image to a specified file.

      Saves an image to the file provided as a parameter. Also saves a set of operations from the file with .ops added. So if you save to some/path/to/image.png, this method will also save the current operations to some/path/to/image.png.ops.

      The AndieFileChooser method should have already checked the imageFilename to ensure that it is sensible. This means that the filename passed to this method is not checked.

      Parameters:
      imageFilename - The file location to save the image to.
      Returns:
      Whether the operation was successful.

    • export

      public void export(String imageFilename)

      Export an image with the current operations to a specified file.

      Exports an image to the file provided as a parameter. The current operations applied to the image are saved onto the new file, and no operations file is generated.

      Parameters:
      imageFilename - The file location to export the image to.

    • makeSensible

      public String makeSensible(String imageFilename)
      Ensures that the extension on the file name is appropriate.
      Parameters:
      imageFilename -
      Returns:
      The inputted imageFilename with the appropriate extension. If imageFilename did not have any extension, or it had an illegal extension (one that ANDIE cannot process), then an appropriate extension is added.

    • makeOpsSensible

      public static String makeOpsSensible(String opsFileName)

      Ensures that the extension on the operation file is appropriate.

      Parameters:
      opsFileName -
      Returns:
      A version of the opsFileName that has the correct extension.

      Apply an ImageOperation to this image.

      Parameters:
      op - The operation to apply.

      public void previewApply(ImageOperation op)

      Show what image will look like when this.apply(ImageOperation op) is executed. Does not save operation to ops.

      Parameters:
      op - The operation to apply.

    • applyOpsFile

      public void applyOpsFile(String opsFilePath)

      Apply operations from an existing operation file to the current image.

      Parameters:

      Save the current macroOps to a file.
      Parameters:
      macroOpsFileName - The file location to save the ops file to.
      Returns:

    • undo

      public void undo()

      Undo the last ImageOperation applied to the image.

    • undoAll

      public void undoAll()

      Undo all operations applied to the image.

    • redo

      public void redo()

      Reapply the most recently undo()ne ImageOperation to the image.

    • redoAll

      public void redoAll()

      Reapply all operations applied to the image

    • pasteFromClipboard

      public void pasteFromClipboard()

      Take the current clipboard, check its data type, and apply to the current EditableImage if it matches. (Image) files copied to the clipboard can also be pasted.

      If a list of files is pasted at the same time, the image files will be turned into a list and presented to the user to ask them which one they would like to copy into the program. Non-image files are ignored.

    • copyToClipboard

      public void copyToClipboard()

      Copy the value of current onto the clipboard. Fails if there is no image loaded into ANDIE, otherwise the clipboard would be overwritten.

    • getCurrentImage

      public BufferedImage getCurrentImage()

      Get the current image after the operations have been applied.

      Returns:
      The result of applying all of the current operations to the original image.

    • refresh

      public void refresh()

      Reapply the current list of operations to the original.

      While the latest version of the image is stored in current, this method makes a fresh copy of the original and applies the operations to it in sequence. This is useful when undoing changes to the image, or in any other case where current cannot be easily incrementally updated.

    • isRecording

      public boolean isRecording()
      Get whether ANDIE is currently in the macro recording state.
      Returns:
      True if ANDIE is in the macro recording state

    • setRecording

      public void setRecording(boolean recording)
      Change the current recording state
      Parameters:
      recording - Whether to set ANDIE in the recording state.
